website_summaries.verdict: Microplane remains one of the most trusted brands for graters, and this particular model is ideal for nutmeg or other spices.
pros: While the holes in this grater may produce too fine a powder for some spices or vegetables, they are perfect for nutmeg
Customers love the incredibly sharp blades and the comfortable rubber handle
If you are looking for a nutmeg grater that will last you for years, this is your best option
cons: The blade cover can be challenging to remove, and this grater is not the most versatile

customer_reviews.title: Knockoff
customer_reviews.text: This is either a knockoff or a very old model, but either way not as pictured. The microplane pictured has a rubber handle, this one is made of hard, cheap plastic and the actual grater is aluminum so is doesn’t adhere to a magnetic knife block like the one I thought I was buying. Because this cheap material was used, the grates are ragged instead of sharp and shred your fingers with the slightest slip. To make matters worse, Amazon won't allow a return for the item for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Inky

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by Cooks Illustrated
customer_reviews.text: I belong to Cooks Illustrated online and always check their equipment review before I purchase ANYTHING for my kitchen. I've had microplanes in the past, I also give them as gifts. Every home should have one or two. This is the one Cooks Illustrated suggested "Buy the winner" so that works for me. It's IMPERATIVE you keep the hard plastic sleeve on it, otherwise, it could bend in the utensil drawer and end up breaking -- but sometimes other people in my kitchen haven't gotten that memo. Wash it immediately after using it, don't put it with anything else until that plastic sleeve protector is on it.
customer_reviews.author: marya

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This is too fine. It turns ginger into mush and takes a lot of rubbing to process it. It doesn't have enough bite to get into a lemon peel. I also bought the Microplane 38000 model which is labeled "coarse" and it is exactly perfect and makes great tiny shreds. This one is very disappointing. A waste of $15.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Useless, probably counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Microplane years ago and loved it. I told my mother about it, and then I bought what I thought was the exact same product for her. She informed me that hers wouldn't grate anything. When I tried it, I saw that the tines were completely flat, therefore useless, and they were extremely easy to bend. I think it must be a counterfeit product. The plastic cover on hers was different from mine, and instead of "Made in USA" printed on the blade, as mine says and in the webpage picture, hers says "Stainless Steel". Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: IggyLove

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay sharp for long
customer_reviews.text: Loved loved loved this when I first got it. I use it to grate ginger for ginger tea and I use it about 2-3 times a day. But...after a few weeks it was noticably duller, and at this point its basically a brute strength effort to grate. But frankly, for the price, it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: RawWit

customer_reviews.title: Poorly manufactured or knockoff
customer_reviews.text: The blades are nearly parallel with the backing, making them absolutely ineffective at zesting because there is effectively no blade angle. If you push your lemon, ginger, etc. into the blades to get any sort of bite it still doesn't bite, and instead turns it into a mush that is pushed out the reverse side of the grater. I'm not sure if it's a knockoff or if it's a manufacturing defect but in either case the product does not work. I replaced this junk 46020 Premium model with the 38004 Professional model, which works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely LOVE this microplaner
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this microplaner. It is sharp and does a quick job of zesting citrus. I also use it for ginger - keep it in the freezer and then grated and used it dishes. It’s like frozen ginger dust and melts right into whatever you add it to.
customer_reviews.author: Misha G.

customer_reviews.title: Best of all
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this little gadget cannot be beat. It is sharp, honed, and effective. Best of all, it grates incredibly easily with application of minimal pressure. I have not shredded my knuckles even once. It rinses clean quickly, even when used for zesting citrus. I also love the color, and it is very easy to find in my overflowing gadget drawer. The protective shield is a little tricky to put back on. Due to the sharpness, I would recommend being very careful when using this device around children. Treat it like a knife or an other dangerous object and keep it well out of their reach.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna L. Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Used?
customer_reviews.text: Handle has missing or scrapped off piece. Item looks used. Was delivered in just a bag no packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Crum

customer_reviews.title: Poorly done
customer_reviews.text: I’m a professional Chef, I use to love this grater/zester but the quality of material since I bought my first many years ago, falls terribly. Last 4 days. Poorly done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's Grate!
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT upgrade from my first Microplane purchased 15 years ago! I'd been storing my old one in my gadget drawer with the original paper sleeve to protect my fingers from cuts. The old one was still sharp and straight after many years of frequent use. I've used this guy for grating parmesan, chocolate, ginger, garlic, onions, nutmeg, cinnamon and of course for zesting lemons and limes. It's easy to use, durable and easy to clean- I wash it by hand and allow it to dry fully before storing. Never a spot of rust. I just LOVE the bright pink handle, it's so cheerful in my colorful kitchen. And the included plastic cover is a GRATE improvement ;)
customer_reviews.author: T-Dub

customer_reviews.title: High quality, not good for grating over a dish
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to support a nightly Parmesan garlic popcorn habit (seriously, try it). With our old grater, which had a plastic frame that broke, we would hold the grater in one hand and a block of Parmesan in the other and grate right over the bowl. That doesn't really work with this grater. It's too narrow and long. It works fine when you brace the end on a cutting board and grate at an angle, although it's still narrow for a block of cheese. We ended up buying a wider, shorter model.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Microplane!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly! The price was reasonable and it's exactly what I was looking for. It is SUPER sharp and shreds hard parmesan cheese with ease. Also works great for zesting lemons and limes. I like that it has a slide on cover for storage, protecting its sharpness and also protecting your fingers when getting it out for use. The handle is rubberized and soft to the touch, making it easy on your hands and gives it a little grip so it stays put while in use.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: It was missing
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered this item with other things and it wasn't in the box with them. I wanted to product support but there isn't any with this item so I was unable to be like hey this wasn't in the box and I didn't receive the item so I ended up ordering another one paying twice for one item. When the second arrived I was so excited! It has a nice ergonomic handle that is probably large enough for someone with arthritis to handle with ease. I like to keep the covers to these which you just squeeze a little and slide it on. It is a nice product
customer_reviews.author: Missie

customer_reviews.title: This is a Kitchen Necessary
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy cooking and have gathered some equipment over the years. Alton Brown and many others have recommended this tool. In my experience it is affordable, well made and often in use for grating chocolate, fruit peels, hard cheeses and more. I am buying another for the kitchen in our cottage.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Mach

customer_reviews.title: Best zester
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best zester and I have purchased several before finally researching and finding this microplane zester. I only realized how poor my other zesters were after trying this. It is able to zest the whole fruit completely and so smoothly. I was able to get so much more zest. I love that the blades come up to the sides so that iI can actually get the zest from areas that are not so flat like the tips, or go around areas where there are blemishes. HIghly, highly recommended. So worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: reena

customer_reviews.title: America’s Test Kitchen choice!
customer_reviews.text: It’s fantastic. It’s the same model I saw on America’s Test Kitchen on PBS. Get it you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Tagatz

customer_reviews.title: If you cook, you need this!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect zester! I’m a home cook. I always thought the graters were also zesters. I wasn’t very good at zesting. It took me too long and I would miss some of the zest or I’d get some of the pith. This zester makes me great at zesting. It’s incredibly quick and with a little practice I get only the zest. Super!
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: this zester is THE S#IT
customer_reviews.text: omfg I had know idea how long suffering I was until I purchased this zester. I use it for lemons and limes as I am addicted to both. Blades are VERY sharp, and I imagine to keep them that way one has to be careful about how one cleans this baby. It' s a bit tough to get all the bounty loose from the surface after zesting too, but these are minor complaints in the context of how effective this thing is. Highly recommend to those who would clean with care.
customer_reviews.author: PasadenaGuiltyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Useless on lemons and daikon
customer_reviews.text: Somehow this tool removes the yellow from my lemon, but gives no zest to put into my cookies? There was just a wet residue and no lemon peal....obviously way to fine of a micro pealer. I went back to my cheese grater.
customer_reviews.author: At home ma

customer_reviews.title: Awful product
customer_reviews.text: My $1 grater from the dollar store worked better than this microplane for cheese, ginger, garlic, you name it. Using it isn't the easiest thing in the world and cleaning ginger out of this thing is a weekend project. Just ridiculous. I returned it ASAP. Maybe I got a bad one because microplanes have a good reputation but I'm sticking with my dollar store graters for now.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Bologna

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: There is a plastic sheath on this microplane, that has a label that runs almost the entire length of the sheath. You can't peel it completely off. It tears off, leaving paper and glue. I had to go in the garage and use mineral spirits and a putty knife to get it off. Then I had to go inside and wash it in soap and water. What kind of marketing department does this company have? Have they ever tried to use this product, like a consumer would? Do you think putting that label on a thin piece of cardboard, instead of glueing it on the sheath might have made your product better? Dumber than dumb!
customer_reviews.author: T. Tobin

customer_reviews.title: so much better than a cheese grater
customer_reviews.text: We use this about once a week on average mostly as a cheese grater, and occasionally as a zester. Had it for a bit over a year and it's still as easy to use as when it was new. It is SO much faster and easier to use than a traditional box grater and we don't miss the different hole sizes at all. It's also easier to clean than a box grater, but if you let stuff dry on it, it can be a bit annoying to clean out (I always need to use a scrubbing brush, which will then get chewed up faster).
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: America’s Test Kitchen for the win!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE microplane. #1 rated by America’s Test Kitchen for a reason. Super effective, durable, and the best price. I use mine for citrus zest and ginger mostly and it is amazing. It creates fluffy piles of whatever you’re zesting easily. My favorite part is that it holds up well in the dishwasher, which is a plus because I don’t want to hand wash something with a thousand tiny blades on it that could cut me or tear up my sponge. Mine goes through the dishwasher 3-4 times per week and still works and looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: beccarice

customer_reviews.title: I Adore this Tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been so frustrated with my grater and zester tools, as they require a lot of effort and don’t produce good results. This product was recommended on the show, America’s Test Kitchen, and I immediately ordered it. It is everything I had hoped for. It takes very little effort and time to grate/zest with it, and it’s extremely sturdy. It has small teeth, so it grates cheeses very finely. I’d like to find a similar quality tool that grates larger shreds too. Definitely buy this - it’s a great price for an impressive tool!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Fry

customer_reviews.title: Great zester!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a big cheese grater to grate lemon zest for years, but finally gave in and got a microplane zester. OMG, I had no idea what I was missing. So easy to use, I don't fear for my fingers (although this thing is wicked sharp, so be careful), and I can zest a whole lemon in about 30 seconds. It's also great for finely minced garlic and ginger. And the fuchsia handle perfectly fits my colorful kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Vannoy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't grate!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for here, this product doesn't grate very well. I've tried it for everything: garlic, ginger, citrus peels. Overall, it doesn't do a good job at getting those fine pieces you want, and most of your item ends up smooshed around the sides and not into your bowl. Shell out an additionally $10 for a better microplane, it'll be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Cook

customer_reviews.title: I have two of these
customer_reviews.text: I use one of them to zest citrus and for culinary uses - it is Lime green Colored. I have another one of these to... well... Zest my feet. It is NOT lime green colored. (important not to mix these up LOL) They both work well and serve their purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Jake the snake

customer_reviews.title: *Grate* for cheese
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this Microplane, I had been gifted a much cheaper brand one. The other did a really poor job of grating or zesting anything, and was a real pain to clean between all the holes in the product. Not the case with this Microplane. The grated cheese and zest simply fall off the Microplane when using, directly onto wherever directed to. Cleanup is a breeze, and just some running water can clean 95% of debris off of it. I'll be purchasing more of the Microplane products.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Roth

customer_reviews.title: Dull
customer_reviews.text: I had my previous microplane for close to 9 years before it went dull. A dull microplane is really good at one thing, grating your finger. After nine years of service I was happy to recycle and order a new one. Unfortunately, this one came dull and I have been seasoning my food with my own skin. YUCK. If it weren't for the Rona, I would have returned. Not worth the trip to the post office.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M. Sapp

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I got a dud, but this thing won’t grate anything. You can literally rub your fingers back and forth on it...it’s useless
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think this is our 4th one.  I have actually used them up
customer_reviews.text: Currently we are still using the 3rd one that we bought. I saw the review on Cook's Illustrated and liked that the new one had a cover. The cover is somewhat difficult to get on and off but I think in the long run it will be better than having it bang around the spoon drawer without protection. We use it for Parmigiano Reggiano, ginger, lime rind, garlic, shallots and although it isn't the easiest thing to clean it does such a fine job as a grater.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara McCray

customer_reviews.title: Works great and holds up well!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Microplane, not because the first broke, but because I lost it. It makes zesting citrus, grating ginger, and just about anything else you could think of using this for a breeze. The most difficult part about cleaning it is my getting over my fear of grating off a bit of my fingers because the blades come sharp and stay sharp. It recommend a microplane to everyone who likes lemon-flavored desserts, or uses ginger in their cooking. This is a great tool, and it's built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Kels

customer_reviews.title: A good multitasker
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing I dislike. It is good for zest and parmesan, the two things I got it to do. I am confident that I will find much more to do with it. I've been using a cheese grater but this tool is far faster and more efficient. It is easy to remove the shredded food off the back and it comes with a cover to protect the blade when in the drawer. Edited for spelling and grammar.
customer_reviews.author: LEE

customer_reviews.title: but this is great and requires little effort
customer_reviews.text: This is a life saver if you use zest in a lot of your recipes. I had always had trouble with other tools and not being able to really zest, but this is great and requires little effort. The sleeve that it comes with is really helpful to keep it sharp and avoid damage to it. I also like the color. I liked mine so much that I bought one to give to my sister.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Quick zesting, good results
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, quick to zest citrus, good yield and easy to recover the zest. Other units I’ve tried over the years made it very difficult to actually gather up the zest and ended up wasting more than half the hard earned zest that always got stuck in the teeth of graters. This unit also is far easier to properly clean which will help the blades stay sharper for much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Uncledavemann

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth and easy to get just the zest
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I got tired of using my old zester that gave me strips of citrus rind. This one gives me fine grated zest, just what I want in my baking. And it's so easy to use. I also bought a glove to protect my hands. This tool is very sharp, so I'm very careful when I clean it. I use a brush and I clean it while the residue is fresh, so it's softer than if I leave it for a while. It comes with a plastic cover, so I toss it in the drawer with my other tools and it keeps it's nice sharp edges. I'd recommend this any time.
customer_reviews.author: AlexO

customer_reviews.title: It's grate
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how much variation there is among zesters, and my sample size is pretty small (I've owned maybe two? in my life?), but this one seems pretty high quality. Good weight and grip, plenty of surface area, sharp where you want it to be sharp. Just zested a lemon (predictable) and it did amazing. The plastic cover that slides over it is thick and really nice for storage. I'd buy it again if I found myself in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: I had been using one of those little zester/peelers and getting increasingly frustrated at how hard it was to zest a lemon. This made it so easy. I can't believe I've never owned one till now. I like the hand grip and the little rubber feet, it stays where you want, and I can just tap it to release all the zest and never have to touch the blade. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Beeks

customer_reviews.title: Works very well - not perfect because base doesn't seem very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product few months ago. Works very well, I use it with cheese predominantly and the grating is much much thinner than your typical grater. It does an amazing job at that. Lemon zest also comes out great. Cleaning is very easy. The only negative point I have is that the base is extremely sturdy. If you were to bend it you may be able to break it with not that much force. I guess at such a low price you can't get everything perfect. Overall for the price very good product, it just doesn't get my 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Billaros

customer_reviews.title: Great zester
customer_reviews.text: One should wear gloves that protect the hand. Makes it safer. Great tool read an article about it today interesting piece. It started out as a wood rasp. Many chefs that are on TV use it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: best brand
customer_reviews.text: Best brand out there for zesters. I have two microplanes in the kitchen, this one for fruit and a slightly larger hole for cheese. They are at least fifteen years old and still sharp as a razor. You need the correct size and there is a right way and wrong way to use it. I work for a woodworking supply company and we sell the exact same microplane zester as a wood shaping plane.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Effective and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is such a handy kitchen tool. It is a really nice length that can be laid across the top of bowls for added support. It has done a great job with citrus fruit (that's really what I bought it for). It is suprisingly easy to clean. I just run water over it and that gets all the particles out of it. I am interested see how it holds up. Honestly, I don't mind buying a new one Evey couple years for how cheap it is.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Davis

customer_reviews.title: Grates parmesan to a fluffy powder.
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully grated hard parmesan to a fluffy powder. So sharp! It feels a lot safer to use because little pressure is needed to produce a good volume of product. Would work grate (teehee) on zesting lemon or crearing chocolate flakes. This is not just a tool geek's kitchenware. I can see myself using this regularly.
customer_reviews.author: JustBasix44

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy!
customer_reviews.text: What I like best about this grater is that the blade is made in USA and not some cheap stuff from China. It is sturdy, easy to use and clean. I get really fine bits of garlic, orange peel, etc, I am so happy I made this purchase. I've only had it for about 3 months, but I've used this at least twice weekly on average. It's that good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Microplane the best on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I look over his Microplane, it grates almost everything for me. I have used this type of microplane for years. It’s now at a point I am buying them for my nieces, nephews and cousins. If you are in t he r market forces microplane THIS is the one to get. Excellent quality, grates very easily from garlic cloves to hard cheeses like Romano.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine M.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!  Works well for zesting lemons or grating nutmeg
customer_reviews.text: First used one of these microplanes in a cooking class. I had not realized how much better they would work than the cheaper variety that we have owned in the past. They are VERY sharp, so the work easily. They do include a plastic cover that protects the blades when they are in a drawer. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: This microplane should be in EVERYONES kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always loved the original microplane. Its very sturdy and easy to use. Nice and sharp with a soft silicone grip handle. Easy to clean. The wide microplane zesters feel like they are going to fall apart. This is the real deal. I have never liked the plastic sleeve that covers the blade. It’s not the easiest thing to get on, but it’s not a drawback at all. I bought the eggplant and it’s very pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Gena Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: There's not one thing I dislike about this product. It zests and grates like a joy. We've zested lemons and oranges. We used it to grate fresh Parmesan cheese. Handles it all with aplomb. Easy to clean! Just plunk down your money and never worry about these chores ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Grate!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because America's Test Kitchen ranked it the highest in their product evaluation. I previously used a box grater for everything, which works, but is much harder to use when you just want a little lemon zest or cheese. The handle is comfortable and the thing stays in place during use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: YR

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: this microplane is made from extremely thin bendable metal. It was shipped in a padded mailer and arrived bent near the handle. This slight bend snapped the metal.
customer_reviews.author: briank

customer_reviews.title: Microplane 46520 premium Zester/Grater
customer_reviews.text: saw alot of Microplane's that had bad reviews and some with great reviews. Believe that the difference is made in china vs made in usa. Mine arrived with made in usa on the blade just below handle ( not visable in photos). This is the good one it is sharp, has two black rubber feet to stablize no complaints here I love it.Get the Microplane 46520 premium zester/grater
customer_reviews.author: catzilla

customer_reviews.title: It is comfortable to use and does "shred"
customer_reviews.text: Really grates products well. My issue is that I was hoping to find a zester where the product, garlic for instance, will drop into the dish as you scrape it instead of just building up in the zester. Maybe I'm looking for something that doesn't exist and they all have that issue. At least all the ones I have tried seem to. It is comfortable to use and does "shred" , scrape, grate or whatever term you want to use the food item well.
customer_reviews.author: roger s

customer_reviews.title: Work Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter in law for Christmas. I already had one and thought she might like one as well. After asking, she says it works great and she uses it daily. I’ve tried cheaper brands with famous names and the microplane far surpasses any of the others regardless of name or price. These are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Susie Davis

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Watched the wife struggle with her old one so I bought this without permission!! Yes it was a gamble !! My wife is particular about her kitchen gadgets. It arrived and I got the stink eye, she used it that night and was so happy with it she made dinner every night this week!! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Simply wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: I loved it before I got it. Absolutly professional. A must have in every kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to clean, easy to store with the included cover. I've only used this to zest lemons and limes, and it works perfectly with just one swipe of each area. It produces very fine citrus zest which is what I prefer. If you like coarser zest, this might not be the utensil for that.
customer_reviews.author: a viewerTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Must for zest
customer_reviews.text: Went so long without this and can’t believe how amazing it works for zest. Stores and cleans well. Easy to use. Very sharp
customer_reviews.author: Lauren S

customer_reviews.title: Great for lemons/madeleines
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily for zesting lemons for cooking or baking Madeleines. This is the best zester I’ve ever tried. I’ve had old ones that usually came with other kitchen stuff but they never got the zest as fine as this one. I’ve since bought one of these for a friend also.
customer_reviews.author: Zain H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent zester!
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much I ended up buying another as a gift for my mother. This saves so much time and is so easy to use. I've even used it for garlic when i have big chunks. The quality is very nice and I've been able to toss it into the dishwasher and it hasn't rusted. I typically hand wash it because it's so easy to clean you just rinse it off. This has assisted me in making some very flavorful and delicious dishes.
customer_reviews.author: ReneeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to tool for zesting citrus and grating hard cheeses and nutmeg. In addition, it’s great for getting a fine pulp of garlic and ginger. I’ve even used it to finely grate onions for the best from-scratch ranch dressing. It has many more uses than I expected when I bought my first one over a decade ago.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: The best zester ever.
customer_reviews.text: The best zester I’ve ever used. We have another one, but it’s old and getting a little dull. I ordered this as a replacement. It works very well, and does an excellent job of zesting lemons, limes or even hard cheese. My only complaint is cleaning it, which can be a little tricky. Still, I love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Joygirl

customer_reviews.title: Strong Micro Zester
customer_reviews.text: The Microplane Premium Zester Grater arrived fast, well packaged, and appears to be excellent quality. I have small hands and the hard plastic handle is to wide for me to grasp and grate safely and comfortably. I must return, but it is an excellent grater. Will look for one with a better grip.
customer_reviews.author: Cali Native

customer_reviews.title: A nice grip means zesting lemons without zesting hands.
customer_reviews.text: After many years of use (at least a decade...) our original Microplane grater seemed like it was a little less great than it once had been. This new grater is greater with a firm non slip grip, and astonishingly sharp microplane blades. It makes quick and easy work of orange zest, lemon zest, hard chocolate, and hard cheeses.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Costa

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I waited so long to purchase one of these but I’m very glad I did. I bought a different design under a celebrity chefs line of tools and it was very difficult to use and a lot of blood was shed. So I pulled the trigger and bought one of these. FABULOUS, get one
customer_reviews.author: Pamela M.

customer_reviews.title: So much better than those grater type zesters
customer_reviews.text: I finally got tired of grating my fingers with my regular zester and purchased a microplane zester. My only complaint is that I didn't do this years ago. Not only is it much safer, faster, and more productive - cleanup is so much easier too.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: I love microplane!
customer_reviews.text: Love this zester! I had the same one all through culinary school and it never wore down, it always stayed super sharp. I eventually ended up losing it on a move and I recently bought this one. (Same zester) I love the longer one. I also have the shorter one.
customer_reviews.author: David and Emily Mcgregor

customer_reviews.title: great grater!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! So far I've just used it to grate fresh vegan parmesan, and it works like a champ. It's easy to hold, grates with little pressure, and for clean up, I've just thrown it in hot soapy water for a few and boom. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: quadruplethreat

customer_reviews.title: A Great Grater
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this purchase. It's lightweight, very easy to grip and made grating ginger and lemon rind very easy and quite fast. Easy to clean (be careful, the little blades are sharp) and the cover slides on easily. It sure beats using the zester on my 5-sided grater. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used it to zest citrus but, wow, this thing is amazing. Razor sharp "teeth" make short work of anything that touches them. The rubber "feet" are ingenious as it doesn't slip around when zesting into a glass bowl. I see this guy lastin a long, long time. Highly recommend. Oh, and the red handle just looks cool.
customer_reviews.author: P. C. Burger

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, very sharp!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a pleasure to use. It is ultra sharp and makes grating and zesting easy. I mostly use it for zesting lemons and grating nutmeg and hard cheeses. It's pretty simple to clean too. I like that it comes with a plastic sleeve to protect it (and your fingers). I just hope it stays sharp for a long time, because I don't think it's possible to re-sharpen.
customer_reviews.author: David Heisel

customer_reviews.title: Grate buy...get it?
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product for someone who is always grating or zesting things in the kitchen. Easy to hold especially with the non-skid feet, and grating is the perfect "size" for our uses. This is so much easier that the usual "pyramid" graters! Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Dr.L.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp but very useful tool for pasta
customer_reviews.text: bought this to shred cheese, it is very sharp! Very sharp! So be careful, i almost cut my finger. But it makes shredded cheese nicely just like the pasta you have in the high-end restaurant.
customer_reviews.author: springroll

customer_reviews.title: For a zesty life
customer_reviews.text: I love this micriolane it is so easy to use with lemon, oranges, limes, parmesan cheese and ginger. Handle was sturdy. I have to be careful not to accidentally scrape my fingers but i love that it is sharp. Cleaning is a slight inconvinience that i could deal with for the sake of fresh zest.
customer_reviews.author: Walter T

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen buy of the year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just before going home for christmas so I could grate nutmeg over homemade egg-nog. The angle of the teeth is much smaller than that of a cheese grater. As a result, the slivers you get are much more thin. I used it for nutmeg, then i used it to zest lemons for lemon curd, and I use it a couple of times per week to grate hard cheese over pasta. The quality of shavings is great. It's better than I expected. One note: I always clean it immediately after using & hand-wash it. I could imagine this being difficult to clean if you let something like cheese get hard on it.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: You Need This In Your Kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I've resisted buying one of these for years and now wish I hadn't waited! Wonderful for citrus zest, parmesan cheese, chocolate. Easy to clean, the handle is comfortable to use while using, and it comes with a sturdy plastic cover to protect the surface (and your fingers) when storing.
customer_reviews.author: Montiel A. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: If you use a box grater, give up and buy this handy item. I don't know why I didn't have one of these years ago, and have scraped my finger enough for a lifetime. This is yet another kichen gadget, but it will be found @ the front of the drawer
customer_reviews.author: rosebud

customer_reviews.title: Produces great zest
customer_reviews.text: Does a quality job taking zest off of citrus, grates parmigiano reggiano into fine airy pieces and turns garlic gloves into great paste. It doesn't work that well grating ginger root though, the holes become clogged with fibers too easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have purchased a couple of microplanes and although they were good for grating things like parmesan cheese they did not perform well when I tried to grate lemons or limes. By far this is the BEST I've ever used. It perfectly grates lemons without getting any of the pith in the mix. I would recommend this for anyone who is looking for a superior grater for their kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: So zesty!  No more cheese grater
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a cheese grater. I’m so ashamed. This thing is awesome. The handle makes it easy to hold and grip. It’s easy to use and clean up is a snap. I love to cook and bake and zesting citrus tends to be a big part of what I need and this has been a great new kitchen tool. Thank goodness for the plastic cover cause it’s sharp!
customer_reviews.author: TgpOKC

customer_reviews.title: Works like magic
customer_reviews.text: This grater works like magic. You can effortlessly grate orange or lemon peel, Parmesan cheese, ginger root, or almost anything grateable. Easy to clean, too. I'd never heard of this tool, but a relative showed me what it will do, and I decided to get one. Makes short work of grating anything.
customer_reviews.author: George B.

customer_reviews.title: Love Microplane products
customer_reviews.text: Want a small mountain of Parmesan? This is the tool to use. I love using this for Parmesan and Romano cheeses when making home made Alfredo sauce. The cheeses melt much easier and smoother for a perfect sauce. I have carpel tunnel and have no problem using as the handle is very ergonomical.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: great kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: One of the greatest kitchen tools I have. It is great for zesting citrus or grating ginger.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use the cover.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful. The blade cover is very difficult to remove. I had to break mine for fear of slicing open my hand. I have a theory that people who design everyday items don’t use those items on a regular basis. Sort of like those that design cup holders in cars. Otherwise the micro plane works well.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Must have in your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This does an amazing job with ginger and parmesean. I had been using a box grater previously and don't know why I didn't get one of these sooner. It does a much much better job than a box grater and this is a must have in any kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: SoutheasternPA

customer_reviews.title: Almost without fault ......
customer_reviews.text: This is the ideal kitchen accessory. I resisted purchasing one for too long. My only complaint is that it is rather tedious to clean. I used a pastry brush, good cleaning means. Works as expected but slow because of fine teeth. Would highly recommend. Already purchased one as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Super smooth and easy zesting!
customer_reviews.text: Smooth and so easy to use! Perfect for zesting orange and lemon like I did today for a cheesecake. I’m going to order another right now to dedicate to garlic!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey R. Mecca

customer_reviews.title: We are now a zesting household
customer_reviews.text: I was at first unsure about purchasing this grater as we have limited storage space and I wasn't sure how often it would get used. Turns out we use it on a weekly basis! Great for zesting fruit but we end up using it for grating hard cheeses like Parmesan or Pecorino for all the Italian dishes we cook! Definitely a great investment! The handle gives you a good grip and it feels nice and sturdy. Comes with a sleeve for the "blade." Doesn't bend much when using lots of pressure to grate things. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: This is the best
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use. I use it all the time and wish I had gotten one a long time ago
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great on oranges & lemons
customer_reviews.text: I've used this zester about 10 times now and it works great on oranges & lemons. It's easy to use with the long handle and easy to clean after using. It's very efficient and removes all the zest from the fruit.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT J.

customer_reviews.title: saw on America's Test Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I am obsessed with this wonderful tool. Great for lemon and orange zest. Ginger and garlic are so easy. I love this tool it is completely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SO worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Apparently, I've never had a real microplaner before as this thing kicks some serious butt, wow! As other reviewers have said, be careful of how sharp it is although, it's really nice it comes with a plastic cover for storage. I really can't recommend this enough!
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Grater
customer_reviews.text: Sad.I purchased this and did not use it right away. Just used it. Cannot return. I personally do not like it. Lemon got stuck.It was hard to clean and for me difficult to use. 15$out!
customer_reviews.author: Minnie

customer_reviews.title: Liked my original one better
customer_reviews.text: My original zester didn't have a handle. I ordered this one for the handle, but I don't like the zester. When I use my zester I hold it grate side down so I can see how much I've grated. The old one had straighter sides so it was easy to see and remove the zest and clean. This one has curved sides so it is more difficult to remove zest an clean.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Slightly hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, slightly hard to clean. Worked exactly how I wanted it to. I have zested limes and ginger with this and it’s perfect in order to remove the skin without grinding away the pith. Slightly hard to clean regarding getting all of the skin out due to all of the small crevices, but I feel like that’s slightly expected without a dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Guerriero

customer_reviews.title: Still a great kitchen “MUST HAVE”
customer_reviews.text: Great having a new one: my old one was not working well, even after having been reversed—-received as a gift back In Mid 90s and it’s an indispensable tool....the old one was just WORN OUT!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Must have utensil
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Microplane grater. I fell for the colorful handle and gave the black handled one to my son. If you store it in the hard shell case that it comes in, it will last without a problem. I clean it with a designated kitchen toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Gem in the desert

customer_reviews.title: Like snow
customer_reviews.text: I can never go back to a normal grater. I use this especially with Parmesan cheese over pasta - texture like snow making it melt beautiful. Also works great with lemon zest (no white pith) you just have to be carefully about not using too much compared to what the recipe calls for
customer_reviews.author: Lauren B

customer_reviews.title: Great Microplane
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased other microplanes that didn't do a very good job. This one removes the perfect amount of zest easily and efficiently. It keeps whatever you are grating contained in a small area so it doesn't make a mess. Very sharp and grates right through cheese as well. Has become one of my favorite kitchen tools.
customer_reviews.author: KY Kay

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: How did I use a box grater for so long? This thing is well made, easy to clean, & so easy to use. I barely use any force and my hard Parmesan grates with such ease. Buy this handy little guy and you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

product_meta.title: Microplane Premium Classic Series Zester Grater, 18/8, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe Microplane premium Black zester/grater is perfect for zesting citrus, grating hard cheese, chocolate, cinnamon, onion, garlic, and ginger. Constructed out of 18/8 stainless steel with razor sharp edges. Premium handles are ergonomic, and soft to the touch. Non-slip rubber feet add stability and protect your plates. Each grater comes with it's own plastic safety cover. Dishwasher safe.
feature_bullets: Zest Citrus: The blade is designed with a specific tooth set that takes the flavorful rind directly off the citrus fruit, while leaving behind the bitter white pith. Zest adds flavor to vinaigrettes, stir fries, salads, and baked goods! Change your life, with a little zest!

Grate Cheese: Grate parmesan into fluffy mounds that melt quickly and look beautiful when treating yourself of family to rustic bowls of pasta. Sprinkle fresh parmesan over eggs, salads, or any dish for a burst of flavor. Grate other hard cheeses like Asiago, Pecorino and Padano.

So Many USES: grate ginger and garlic into a minced pastes to flavor many popular foods. Create ground spices from whole hard cinnamon or nutmeg. Use to shave a cork down to fit back into a bottle - even scrape off burnt or dark spots from cookies, scones, and toast. The possibilities are endless.

Ultra Sharp Made in USA blades: Microplane uses photo-etched technology to make ultra sharp grating blades right here in America! Made of surgical grade stainless steel this material stays rust-free and maintains sharpness over time. True stainless steel is magnetic, so this item can be hung on your magnetic knife strip. Non-scratch end tabs help protect counter tops

Dishwasher Safe: The tool is easy to clean, simply rinse immediately after use. Use a kitchen brush on the underside of the blade to clean out tough to reach particles. The zester/grater can also be placed in the dishwasher.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars12,260 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
